fields.headline: Calzaghe wins without impressing
fields.bodyText: Joe Calzaghe admitted he got his tactics wrong despite making a successful defence of his WBO and IBF super-middleweight titles against Cameroonian Sakio Bika. Calzaghe, who produced 12 scintillating rounds of boxing to beat American star Jeff Lacy earlier this year, was unimpressive againt his African opponent, even more so after a cut opened up above his left eye at the end of the fourth round. The Welsh fighter, who won with a unanimous points decision, told ITV1: "I'm disappointed with the performance, I couldn't get off the way I would have liked to get off, but a win is a win. I'm disappointed, I wanted to put on a spectacle. He was a dirty fighter, he got caught a lot with (using) the head. I wasn't 100% tonight and it showed. He continued, "I probably didn't get my tactics right, I was a bit too hasty to start with." Promoter Frank Warren was also critical, he said, "I am upset with him especially when he was showboating and dropping his hands, I don't like that. Joe is a tremendous boxer but he was hampered by that cut. One thing you can't doubt with Joe Calzaghe is he has a fighter's hearts." However, Warren insists a springtime super-fight is still very much in the offing for Calzaghe.
